summary: This bill, the "Cutting Unobligated Tumultuous Spending Act" (H.R. 1654), aims to rescind unobligated COVID-19 relief funds and certain infrastructure funds to offset the cost of supplemental foreign assistance for fiscal year 2024. Primarily, it targets unused funds from various COVID-19 relief acts and specific infrastructure programs such as the Education Stabilization Fund, Congestion Mitigation and Air Quality Improvement Program, Carbon Reduction Program, and PROTECT Program. The rescinded funds will be directed towards covering the costs of foreign aid initiatives.
